intro: Celmisia lindsayi, commonly known as the Lindsay's celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring cool and moist conditions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. Celmisia lindsayi is often found in the South Island and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
